“Hey Robert,’ called out Greta from across the School’s Parking Lot. ‘Are you done with Cross Country Practice? I need a ride home.”

Looking behind him, Robert saw his little sister Greta come running up to him from the direction of the School Gym. “Yeah, I’m heading home now. What are you still doing here? I thought Basketball didn’t start until next month.”

Coming to a stop a foot away from her brother, Greta said, “True, but I still wanted to get some practice in with some of the other Varsity players. So, I can improve my game.”

“Sounds good. Hop in. I just need to stop at the store for a few things, okay?” said Robert as he opened the front driver side door of the minivan that his parents got him; threw his gym bag in the back and got in.

“Fine,” said Greta as she got into the front seat next to her brother. Putting down her gym bag down at her feet.

Robert drove 10 minutes down the road to the local Safeway store and parked near the front of the parking lot. “Ok, so are you going to wait for me here or going to come in with me?”

“Na, I’ll step into that shop over there. Mystic Worlds. I always get a kick out of looking around those type of places. You never know, I might find something I’m into that I didn’t know I was into,” said Greta, getting out of the car and heading to the shop next to the grocery store.

“See ya in a few minutes out here Greta. Fifteen minutes max. I’ve got homework to do,” said Robert as he got out of the car walked towards the Grocery store.

Greta walked into ‘Mystic Worlds’ and started to browse. The store itself was a basic type of store of its’ kind, filled with figurines of Dragons and fairies and castles to go along with shelves of books from Wiccan to ghost sightings to “Natural” healing. Nothing caught Greta’s interest. Making her way back towards the door, Greta passed a table near the corner of the store, when something caught her eye on the table. Stopping in her tracks, Greta looked down at the table. Browsing the tabletop she saw many different nick-knacks sitting on the table, but one in particular caught her eye. It was a white marble shaped item only bigger. Greta picked it up, it fit snugly in her right hand. Holding it up to her face Greta saw that there was a neon white glow to it that started to get brighter and brighter.
“That’s a special one you have there. One of a kind actually,’ said a female voice behind Greta. ‘Very powerful.”

Gasping, and almost dropping the marble, Greta turned around to see the store owner standing behind the cash register. “Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t see you there Mrs. Maple. I was just looking that’s all….”

“…Greta? Are you still in here? It’s time to go,” said Robert as he walked in through the front door of the store.

143.content:
Robert smiled as he closed the front door, his sister having entered the house a head of him. His parents typically parked in the driveway, as the garage was cluttered with boxes, and only one car was parked in the drive way. He checked his phone, which notified him of one new message. "Date night tonight!" Robert read the text aloud for his sister. "Will be back late. Leftovers are in the fridge. Smiley-face. Heart."

"That couldn't have worked out any better." Greta grinned. "Gives us plenty of time to experiment with the Switcheroo Orb."

"What did you call it?" Robert asked.

"The Switheroo Orb. Mrs. Maple never said what it was called, so I named it." She explained cheerfully.

"I guess that works." Robert pondered the name for a moment but decided that he like it. He then commented abruptly, "We should invite Hansel over."

"What? Why?" Hansel questioned as she turned her head slightly away.

Robert smiled as his sister's cheeks turned a slight shade of red. Hansel was a mutual friend of theirs and a 10th grade student at their high school, the grade in between his and his sister's. Robert had met Hansel back in elementary school, and they became fast friends despite the slight difference in their grade level. Back then, the three of them often rode dirt bikes, played video games, or other activities together. As they grew up, Hansel continued to be close friends with both of the siblings, but more recently, he knew his sister had formed an infatuation with their good friend, hence the rosy red cheeks when he mentioned inviting Hansel over.

"We have to include some others in this. It won't be anything interesting if it is just us two." Robert reasoned. His sister acknowledged his point, and he quickly pulled out his phone again to call their friend. After not-so-patiently waiting for Hansel to arrive, he and his sister enthusiastically greeted him as he opened the front door. Hansel was slightly taller than him, roughly an inch or two. But, he also had a lean build, having spent the last two years in the high school's swim team. He smelled faintly of chlorine.

"Dude, this is incredible." Robert began as he lead Hansel and Greta into the living room. The room was spacious, with a soft white carpet, two couches, and an dark oak coffee table. The carpet was soft, perfect in case the orb accidentally fell from someone's hands.

"What is so incredible that I had to rush over here?" Hansel questioned.

"This." Greta slowly opened the case containing the Switcheroo orb.

"That looks like a... foggy crystal ball?" Hansel guessed. "Are we having a seance? I'm down."

"Not quite." Robert said as he carefully removed the orb from the clam-like chest, cradling it in his hands. "Touch the top of the orb, and tell me what you think?"

Hansel had a puzzled look on his face as he stared from one sibling to the other. "Okay..." He said as he placed a hand over the orb.

Immediately, the smoke-like substance in the orb began to spin. Robert smiled as his soul, or essence, began to glow in a silver light, and as he looked at his friend, Hansel seemed to glow in a strange steel grey color. He wondered for a moment, why he and his friend both glowed in similar colors, and why his sister was a purple. He lost his train of thought when he felt himself, his soul, being pulled into the orb. He rotated around, feeling the presence of his scare friend. A moment later, he was expelled. He blinked a couple of times, watching as his original body, currently being inhabited by Hansel, fearfully looked at him.

The orb fell from his original, Hansel's, hands. Greta was quick to catch it, having been prepared for the orb to fall. "Its such a strange feeling, right?" She asked.

"What the hell just happened?" Hansel, in Robert's body questioned. "Am I... Did we switch bodies?" He looked at his original body, currently being occupied by Robert.
143.title: Switcheroo Orb: Hansel and Robert Exchange Bodies

choices: Robert and Hansel are stuck in the orb together
Robert and Hansel are both expelled into Robert's body
The orb begins to absorb Robert's body
1432.content:
"Yeah! The orb actually swaps people's bodies." Robert exclaimed, though the sound of his voice, Hansel's voice, made him pause. Even though he knew what the orb was going to do, switching into his best friend's body was still surreal. He looked at his hands, his friend's body's hands, turning them around slowly. "Its pretty freak, right?" He walked over to the mirror hung on the far wall of the living room. His reflection was that of Hansel's body. Then, Hansel walked up beside him. Standing beside his original body, and seeing someone else 'drive' it made chills run down Robert's spine.

Robert watched as Hansel pressed a hand on the mirror, as if it were some elaborate prank. "We really are in each other's bodies. Where did you..."

"From Mystic Worlds" Robert answered, knowing his friend knew of the little shop by the grocery store. Mrs. Maple had set up shop a year ago, but Robert never understood why. It had the appearance of an antique store, and he did not understand who in their small town would actually shop there. Obviously, she had more to sell than simple old trinkets. "Greta is actually the one you can thank. She found the orb, and nearly scared the shit out of us."

Hansel turned around quickly to look at Greta. "You and him... me, no... his body." he stammered, seemingly having difficulty coming up with the right words.

"Yeah, my brother and I switched bodies by accident." Greta clarified. "Trust me, it was very awkward experience, but it is easily fixed. All you have to do is touch the orb again."

"Like this..." He reached for the orb in Hansel's hand, but Greta, quick on her feet, stepped back.

"If you wanted to switch bodies with me, then yeah. But, I'd prefer not to be in his body again." She stated, matter of factly.

"Yeah, because I am sure you would want to 'experience' this one." Robert teased.

Greta immediately turned red, "No..."

Hansel looked between them, clearly clueless of Greta's crush on him. "Um... do you want to fill me in?"

"How about you guys just switch back? I would like to have my brother, as my brother." Greta stated, having difficulty looking at either Robert or Hansel.

"But why, we just switched places?" Hansel questioned. "You guys wanted to experiment right? There must be more that the orb can do than just switch people's bodies. What if there was only one body touching the orb after both people were pulled inside?"

"Huh, I wonder what would happen." Robert thought about the swirling cloud within the orb. For a few moments with each switch, he was inside the orb, not inside any body. "Lets do it."

Despite Greta's complaining, she agreed to help with their little experiment. It was decided that Hansel, in Robert's body, would hold the orb while Robert, in Hansel's body, would touch the orb with one hand. Greta would then push Hansel's body's hand off of the orb once both were pulled inside of it.

With everyone in agreement, they started the process. Robert felt himself being pulled into the orb, immediately after placing a hand on top. Separated from Hansel's body, he watched from inside as Greta grabbed their friend's arm, yanking it away from the orb.
1432.title: Switcheroo Orb: What Else Can It Do?

choices: Robert and Hansel awake inside identical bodies (Identical Twins)
Robert and Hansel awake inside a single body (Conjoined Twins)
14323.content:
It was on this day that Robert, Greta, and Hansel all learned never to experiment with magical artifacts, for the result is rarely beneficial for the individuals involved. Magical objects, like the orb, are created for one purpose in mind, and unexpected consequences can occur when the magic is interrupted. Robert and Hansel were going to learn this lesson first hand.

Robert's hands continued to cup the orb while Hansel's arm was pulled away. Robert felt his soul being expelled from the orb and into his body, and not unexpectedly, he sensed friend also being pushed into his body as well. He figured that since only his body was in contact with the relic, it only made since that it would try to put both of them into one body. 'Guess Hansel and I are going to be closer friends for a bit.' he thought to himself.

As the orb pushed himself and his friend into his body, he felt a growing resistance of sorts. The only way he could describe it was being cramped. His body felt cramped. Robert realized with dread that his body, perhaps all bodies, could only house one soul. Despite the uncomfortable resistance, the orb seemed to push harder, forcing his and Hansel's souls into the too small confines of his body. His body begin to convulse.

"Robert... Hansel..." He heard his sister call their names, her voice in a panic. "What is happening?"

Robert tried to speak, but only garbled noises came out. He realized that Hansel was also trying to talk, and his mouth could not form the words that either was trying to convey. Sweat began to drip from his forehead and from his armpits. His palms grew clammy. The veins in his arm began to grow dark, as if suddenly filled with lead. "Am I dying!' Robert panicked.

As if to answer, the contents within the orb began to spin and glow brighter than before. Robert felt himself and Hansel being pulled back into the safety of the orb. But his body continued to to be wracked with some unknown symptoms. Steam began to lift from his shoulders. His skin seemed to vibrate and move like individual grains of sand.

Greta, probably in a panic as well, placed Hansel's hand back onto the orb. Robert felt himself and Hansel being pushed, expelled like toothpaste from a tube, into Hansel's body. But the same thing began to occur. Hansel's body began to convulse, and then his veins became dark. Robert and his friend found their souls back inside the orb and watched in horror as their bodies began to disintegrate before their very eyes.

The orb not levitated into the air, no longer being held aloft by Robert's hands. Like a small sun, the particles that made up Robert's and Hansel's bodies began to orbit around the relic, creating a thick ring of sorts. Whatever magic was occurring, seemed to be taking its toll on the orb. Robert panicked from within the relic as cracks began to appear over the surface. If the orb shattered, Robert did not want to find out what would happen to himself or Hansel if they were still contained within.

Miraculously as if the sand had a mind of its own, it began to take shape. The particles, in a stream, left orbit around the orb and began to form, legs, arms, a torso. Robert realized that they were forming into a body. He smiled, though he had not face yet. He and Hansel would not die within their current prison. It was forming them bodies. Robert did not care what his body looked like, so long as he and Hansel were able to escape for the orb broke into pieces. As if reading his mind, Robert felt himself being expelled from the orb. The world became dark as his soul passed into the still forming body. But just before he lost all sense of what was going on in the outside world, he knew the orb had shattered.
14323.title: Switcheroo Orb: Learning the Hard Way

choices: Greta leaves to ask Mrs. Maple for assistance
Robert and Hansel explore their combined body
143232.content:
"Robert... Hansel... Robert..." a voice called, sounding a lot like his sister. Her tone indicated concern about something, but Robert's foggy brain could not reason why. At the sound of his name being repeated, he slowly awoke. He tried to sit up, but an unusual weight to his left kept him pinned down.

"Greta..." he whispered groggily.

"Yeah... Are you Robert or Hansel?" she asked.

"Of course its me." The questions sounded preposterous to him, until the events that had just occurred began to flood his mind. He remembered being in the orb, his body and Hansel's body disintegrating, and the orb forming something new. He assumed that the orb remade their bodies, but they may not have been placed back into the correct ones. "Right... its Robert." he answered, though he became aware that the sound of his voice was off. It did not sound like himself, and he wondered if he was placed into Hansel's body.

Ignoring the strangeness of his voice for now, he focused his eyes ahead of himself, realizing that he was lying on the carpet of his living room and staring at the ceiling. His bare ass was touching the carpet, and he had a blanket over himself, probably from Greta. He reasoned that his new body must have been naked, and his sister hastily covered him up.

Greta walked into his view, concern clearly etched on her face. "I'm glad your okay Robert." Her tone of voice seemed to indicate that he did not look okay though.

"I'm... is okay too. Thanks for asking." an unfamiliar voice spoke up beside him.

Robert rotated his head to the left and was surprised to see another boy, lying close beside him, looking upwards at his sister. He did not recognize him, but he figured that it must be his friend. "Hansel?" he asked, to confirm his suspicion.

The other boy turned at the sound of his name. "Robert? Is that you?"

"Yeah..." He answered, his cloudy mind working to process what had occurred. Hansel clearly did not recognize him, and he did not recognize his friend's face. But as he looked at his friend's confused face, Robert felt like he should know that face. His friend's new face seemed familiar and not at the same time. "So... I guess we got two totally new bodies from the little accident." Robert reasoned aloud.

He noticed his sister make a pained expression after he spoke, which concerned him. "What?" he and Hansel asked in eerie tandem. He and Hansel turned to look at each other, seemingly studying each other's face. "Are we twins now?" They asked in tandem again.

Despite the situation, Robert smiled. He found the idea of having Hansel as a twin, or himself being Hansel's twin, interesting. Why Hansel looked familiar, and yet not would make since if the orb mixed up their features. It was defiantly not the worst thing that could have happened.

But, something nagged at his brain, that he and Hansel were not just identical in appearance. His skeptical side asked, 'Why were they under the same blanket?' He would answer himself, 'Because they fell beside each other after the orb created them new bodies.' His skeptical side followed up, 'Why were you having difficulty sitting up then?' He would answer himself, 'Because Hansel must have fallen on top of him.' His answer seemed reasonable enough, and it would account for why his left arm and leg felt numb. The weight of his friend's body was slowing the circulation to his limbs.

Robert looked at his friend again. He realized that Hansel's head was not positioned in a way for him to be lying on top of him. It was more like he was lying directly beside him, flat on the carpet. Robert pressed his right hand and foot into the carpet and pulled. He felt like he was dragging his half-limp body, but Hanel's head seemed to move with him, staying just as near to him. His friend was uncomfortably close, about half a shoulder length away.

"Why are you dragging me?" Hansel complained.

"I'm not dragging you, I'm dragging me." Robert replied. A moment later, he felt himself being jerked to the left, but it felt different than someone simply pulling his arm. It was like his torso was being pulled from the inside, as if half of his muscles tried to pull him in the opposite direction. He knew that something was very wrong, and his friend's expression mirrored how he felt.

Robert pressed his elbow into the carpet and tried to raise his torso off of the carpet again. This time, the extra weight to his left was lessoned, as if some other force was pushing his torso up as well. As his torso rose, the blanket fell off his chest, and Robert had to stifle a scream. There was only one body under the blanket. With his gaze, he followed the outline of two legs from under the blanket, to his unfamiliar, toned stomach. His gaze continued upward to his chest, to a second neck, and then to his friend's head. The orb had not given them their own bodies, only one. "No... way..." he whispered. He and Hansel were sharing a single, combined body.

He slowly raised his hand into his view, examining it. His arm was different, unfamiliar, but it was his. As he looked toward what should have been his left arm, he had no feeling of it. Despite the left arm being attached to the same body as him, he could not control it. He realized that the sensations of his body seemed to stop half-way across his chest. He watched as what should have been his left arm clench and unclench the fingers. Hansel was moving it, not himself. Robert looked at Hansel, just has his friend turned to look at him. They stared at each other for a few long moments. Unceremoniously, he and his friend stated in tandem, "Shit!"
143232.title: Switcheroo Orb: One Two-Headed Body

choices: Perspective Change: Greta seeks Mrs. Maple for help
Robert and Hansel explore their body
1432321.content:
Robert flinched when he and Hansel spoke at the same time, in eerie stereo. He tried to pull away, to get more room between himself and his friend, and seemingly, Hansel had the same idea in mind. He felt the muscles in his chest and abdomen be pulled uncomfortably taught, like the center of their chest was the rope in a game of tug of war. He moved no further away from his friend. Robert stopped his attempt, nearly as soon as he started.

His eyes gaze back at his unfamiliar chest. "What the hell happened to us?" His brain was having a difficult time processing what he saw, what he felt. It was a strange experience being within someone else’s body, but this was something else entirely. He felt his chest, or at least his half of it, raise from an unsteady breathe by his friend. He could feel the air enter his lungs.

Out of the corner of his eye, he saw Hansel look towards Greta. His friend's voice came out, like a whimper, "How do we fix this?"

Greta looked teary-eyed, and Robert knew his sister felt shameful, as if this was all her fault. "I... I... I don't know. Mrs. Maple...”

Hansel looked at Robert, his eyes seemed to plead with him. "I..." Robert swallowed hard, trying to keep his voice steady. He clenched his fist tightly, his knuckles becoming white. "We'll figure something out." His words sounded empty.

"We'll figure what out?" Hansel questioned, sweeping his arm over them. Panic and fear emanated in his voice, but Robert did not need to hear his friend's words, to understand his alarm. Beside his own terry, he could almost feel his friend's fear, on top of his own.

"We can't panic. That's not going to help us." Robert tried to keep his voice calm. His words were far easier to say than to practice. His mind raced with questions. ‘Was this permanent? How to they separate into two bodies? Why did the orb only make one body?’

Hansel took a deep breathe, seemingly trying to quell his own emotions. "And what will?"

"Mrs. Maple..." Greta offered. "She may know... something."

Robert realized that his sister was holding something. It took him a moment to see that it was the open box that they had purchased along with the crystal ball. Inside were the fragments of the once whole orb. Greta seemed to have hastily picked up the pieces while he and Hansel were unconscious.

"Go... maybe she knows of something." Robert urged.

His sister abruptly turned to walk towards the front door, but stopped just outside the living room threshold. She set the box down on shelving in the hallway and walked back to Robert and Hansel with her phone out. "Pictures are sometimes greater than words..." Greta stated, her voice sounded more controlled.

Robert looked toward Hansel, sharing a knowing look. He imagined that Mrs. Maple may need a photo of them, at least just to see the extent of what the orb had done to them. They both nodded their heads in approval. Greta took a picture of them, with half of their body still underneath the blanket. She picked up the box as she left the house.

Robert almost called out to ask her how she was going to get to Mrs. Maple's shop, since she did not know how to drive, but he decided against saying anything. His sister would think of something, even if it just meant that she bicycled the few miles to the shop. Their hometown was small, easy to traverse from one side to the other in less than an hour on bike.

Robert turned towards Hansel, his friend already looking at him from the corner of his eyes. He knew that they would be alone together for one or two hours while his sister was gone. He hoped that this was the only time they would have alone together, in their current state. They were best friends, but he could not imagine, did not want to imagine, being forced to live his life side-by-side with Hansel.

Hansel sighed heavily beside him. "How does an orb that switches people's bodies make us into... this."

Robert shrugged his shoulder in response, and he felt the muscles between his and Hansel's necks flex. "That felt weird." Robert stated to himself.

Hansel turned his face toward him again. "I felt you... shrugging here." He touched the space between their necks, and Robert flinched.

"I didn't expect to feel that." Robert stated as he placed his hand beside Hansel's. He traced this common center, down the length of their chest and abdomen, and Hansel shuddered in response. "Looks like there is some overlap where we can... both feel." It was an odd experience to feel his hand touch his stomach, but also know that his best friend could also feel him touching his stomach.

Robert’s eyes shifted downward to the blanket that hid the bottom half of their body. He stared for several long moments at the space between their two legs. Curiosity getting the better of him, he grabbed the side of the blanket around their hips and tossed it aside, revealing their lower half.

"Dude!" Hansel complained, but did not reach to grab the blanket. He seemed just as curious as Robert was.

They both stared at the single, unfamiliar penis nestled between their individual legs. "That doesn't look like mine..."

Hansel frowned. "Its not mine either." After a few moments, he stated. "The orb didn't just slap us together, it completely blended us into one person."

"We're still two separate people." Robert stated.

"Where?" Hansel argued. "Please, show me where you end and I begin."

Robert had to concede that Hansel had a point. Not only were their two heads on top of the same body, but their body seemed to be some combination of their previous forms. The only parts that were not completely blended together were their heads. “Granted, we share… most of this body, but we each seem to only have control over our half...”

“A lot of good that does.” Hansel scoffed. “We get to retain half of the body each, but we have to move together just to go anywhere.”

Robert had not thought that far ahead, but clearly his friend had. He was not sure how they were going to move their joint body. “Let’s take this one step at a time. Greta is going to get help. We can…” He paused, feeling a familiar pressure build in his bladder, their bladder. “…relieve ourselves…” Robert’s cheeks flushed red as he spoke. Hansel seemed to have a similar reaction as his friend’s cheeks turned ruby red as well. Robert could feel the heat leaving his friend’s face.

“Then get dressed.” Hansel supplied. “No use running around in the nude.”
1432321.title: Switcheroo Orb: Trying to Remain Calm

choices: Perspective Change: Hansel and Robert explore their body
Perspective Change: Hansel and Robert hear the news from Greta
14323211.content:
Greta rode as quickly as she could with the box, containing the shards of the crystal ball, under her arm. She had suggested leaving the house to find Mrs. Maple for two reasons. The first was obvious. The old shopkeeper of magical relics was the only person she knew who could have answers, and if there was anyone that could help her brother and friend, it would be her. The second was to get away from the now conjoined twin boys. Greta felt a lump form in her throat; guilt was welling up in her chest. She felt responsible for Hansel and Robert becoming what they were now. She could not stay in the house, or the guilt would have been too much.

Even now, remorse threatened to overwhelm her. She forced herself to focus on the road, taking the quickest route she knew back to the shop. "All I can do now is find Mrs. Maple..." She whispered to herself.


After turning into the store's parking lot, she unceremoniously dropped her bike just outside the door. She ran inside, the container still in one hand. "Mrs. Maple... Mrs. Maple!" she called out.


"Dear... I heard you the first time." She walked into Greta's view from the back of the shop. She gave Greta a once over and brought a finger to her chin as if in deep thought. "To whom am I speaking too?"

"Its me... Greta. I am still myself, but..." Greta replied but had difficulty finding the words. "Please just look." Greta opened her phone to the image of her brother and friend.

Mrs. Maple took the phone but squinted at the image. "I don't have my glasses... These little screens are so hard to see." She set phone down on the counter. Greta watched as the woman did what she could only describe as real 'magic'. The older lady put each of her pointer fingers against her opposite thumb, creating a rectangle. Keeping her fingers in their 90 degree angle positions, she moved her hands apart. As her hands separated, the image on the phone seemed to expand off of the phone, as if it were some kind of hologram. "Oh my..." was the only comment the lady could make upon seeing the image clearly.

Upon request from Mrs. Maple, Greta explained what had transpired. She described how her brother and friend had switched bodies with no trouble, and that Hansel had a curious idea about the object. The three of them decided to test it, and it resulted in Hansel and Robert sharing a twin-like body. "And then... the crystal ball shattered. I... have all of the pieces. If that helps..." Greta said meekly.

The old lady seemed shocked, as she stumbled into a chair. "My... I have never heard of such a thing occurring. If you did not have the image, I am not sure I would have believed you." She cupped her hands. "You never should have tampered with a magical object. It always results in unexpected consequences."

"I know... but can you help them." Greta begged. "You have to be able to do something."

Mrs. Maple sighed heavily, "Unfortunately, I doubt I could do anything to help."

"But you're a witch!" Greta exclaimed.

"Don't call me that!" The old woman spat. She then appeared to visibly calm herself down. "I have some magic, yes, but I do not have the strength to undo what has happened to your brother and friend. And like I had said before... that was the last orb in existence. All of the others were destroyed, long ago. I am sure you can imagine why..." Mrs. Maple explained. "Being able to swap bodies gives a person a limited form of immortality. Rasputin, himself, was the last wielder of an orb. That is how he was able to survive those attempts on his life."

"I don't care about the history lesson. Robert and Hansel didn't just switch bodies!" Greta angrily spoke up. "They... fused together."


"Its possible that you three stumbled onto a secret function of the orb, or they just got lucky..." Mrs. Greta explained.

"Lucky!" Greta fumed. "Look at them... that does not look lucky."

"Do not raise your voice at me girl! That is a much better fate than being trapped inside the orb, or dead." Mrs. Maple explained. She waved her hand, and the image shrunk back into the phone. Sensing that Greta was near to tears, the woman said gently, "Unfortunately, there is nothing I can do. But, I will put word out to others that I am in contact with. One of them may know something I do not." She sighed again, "Do not get your hopes up, but contacting my acceptances is the least I can do."

With little else to say, Greta walked out of the shop, with the box under her arm. It suddenly felt much heavier than it had before.
14323211.title: Switcheroo Orb: Seeking Help

1432322.content:
“I think both of you should learn how to stand and walk together before you try anything else,’ said Greta. ‘Wouldn’t that be one of the first things you try to do anyway?”

Both Hansel and Robert were taken aback by that thought. Neither even considered what it would be like now, having to work in tandem to walk. Robert, took a deep breath, it felt weird. Like breathing only half as much as he was used to. Breathing again, it felt different this time, both lungs breathed at the same time. Then both lungs filled up with air again. “Our bodies must be in the process of synchronizing,’ thought Robert. ‘No, that thought is just to distract me from the truth! Greta is right, Hansel and I will have to learn how to walk again, together. We can’t just Lay here all day.”

“What?! Shouldn’t we be getting help from someone? I mean shouldn’t we be going back to get help from Mrs. Maple at least? Practicing walking seems petty,” said Hansel, a tinge of panic in his voice.

“And how are you going to do that Genius,’ said Greta. ‘You going to get me to drag you all the way down the Mrs. Maple’s shop?”

“I don’t know. This is sort of, crazy. I mean I’m stuck to my best friend and now I also kind of look like a mix of him and me,’ said Hansel. ‘This all is just so much to take in.”

“’Stuck to my best friend’. You make it sound like Greta and I planned this just to torture you,’ said Robert. ‘Why don’t we at least just try to get our balance and working knowledge of how to walk before we completely panic? Greta is right, she can’t drag us down to Mrs. Maple’s shop to figure out what happened to us. Let alone go to the hospital. At the hospital they’ll probably have to quarantine us and study us for years to come if we go there and tell them what happened to us.”

“Sorry, I didn’t mean to snap at you two,’ said Hansel. ‘This just took me by surprise. You’re right Robert. We have to work the problem at hand first.”

“Okay, lets start by trying to sit all the way up,” said Robert.

In tandem, Robert and Hansel tried to sit up. After several times of failing, there were able to sit up, as one, completely.

“Well, that wasn’t too hard was it?” said Hansel with a smile of success.

“Still have a long way to go,’ said Robert, reaching his hand out to Greta. ‘Greta, if you could help us stand up it would make things go a lot smoother.”

“Sure,” said Greta, grabbing his hand and pulling them upwards.

Trying to stand up in unison, Both Robert and Hansel tripped over their respected foot and fell forward as the stood up at their zenith. Tumbling over on top of Greta.

The left head of Robert’s and Hansel’s new body dropped onto Greta squarely, coming within a couple of inches of her face.

Greta moaned, out of breath.

“Are you okay!?” asked Hansel.

Opening her eyes, Greta looked into worried Green-blue eyes. “I’m Fine.’ A wave of Butterflies fluttered through her belly. ‘Are you two okay?”

“Yes, we’re Fine,’ said Robert and Hansel simultaneously. Hansel felt butterflies rush through his belly. Robert felt the beginnings of arousal, embarrassment flushed his face once he realized it was coming from Hansel.

“Let’s keep trying at this,” said Robert quickly, trying to avert what he knew Hansel felt, in that moment, towards his sister.

Realizing who he was attached to, Hansel’s face reddened. “I’m sorry Robert. You’re right, let’s get focus on standing and walking.”

“Uh, yes,’ said Greta, embarrassed herself at her butterflies. She pushed the two off of her. Standing up, she continued, ‘Here. Take my hand. Let’s Try to get you two standing. Steadily this time.”

Hansel reached for her hand, grabbed it. Robert and Hansel, more steadily, stood up.

Robert smiled at Hansel, "Hey, we're standing." It was a small victory that he and his friend remained upright. It was difficult to put words to the sensation, but simply standing felt very different while sharing his body. Robert felt that his center of gravity, or rather his and Hansel's center of gravity, was somewhere in the space between their two heads. It felt unusual because their heads were off-center, seemingly evenly spaced across their broadened shoulders. To Robert, he felt as if he was balancing on one leg and leaning slightly into an invisible wall. The four of us had a picnic by the lake during the summer of their junior year. Your father and I were lying on the sand, enjoying each other's company while Mike and Mark were racing. Robert woke up feeling a little groggy. He kept his eyes shut for a moment; he didn’t feel fully awake. “What a nightmare I had,” thought Robert, raising his right hand up to his forehead. Robert opened his eyes. Looking up towards the ceiling he realized he had slept on his back; he hadn’t slept on his back since he was a little kid. Not thinking much of it, Robert felt like he needed to go to the bathroom so he tried to get out of bed; only to be able to move his right side of his body. Surprising him.

“What the…?” Robert said out loud in a low raspy voice, looking to his left. He gasped. A sleeping head was laying there, less than two inches away from his face. It was attached to his body at the shoulders. The room was still dark, the sun was barely rising over the horizon; Robert couldn’t identify what the head looked like clearly. Robert gasped again, as memories of yesterday flooded back into his mind. The Magic Shop him and his sister went into, the orb she bought, it switching the user’s bodies and then suddenly it breaking after Him and Hansel’s bodies combined into one. On top of that, Robert realized that his mom gave him a bombshell with admitting that his uncles weren’t always conjoined but the first half of their childhood they were separate people, cousins, but still separate people. It was still a lot for Robert to process, especially so early in the morning.

Hansel stirred, moaned, and slowly opened his eyes. “Man, that was one hell of a nightmare. For a second there I thought I was actually attached the Robert,” said Hansel sleepily.

“You’re telling me,” said Robert sarcastically, feeling wide awake and still feeling the need to get to the bathroom.

Gasping, Hansel looked to his right. Eyes widened in surprise. “It actually happened, I’m a freak!” said Hansel, as the memories of yesterday flooded his mind.

“I don’t know about being a ‘Freak’ Hansel but I know for a fact that you feel the need to go to the bathroom just as much as I do. So, if you don’t mind, could we get each other to the bathroom before we do anything else,” said Robert, matter of factly.

“Okay, okay. Let’s go,” said Hansel, more awake than a second ago.

“On three. One, two, Three,” said Robert as the two of them sat up together.

“Okay, great! Let get out of bed and to the bathroom,” said Hansel. The two of them quickly got out of bed, walked slowly to the bathroom and did their business.

As they washed their hands, Robert asked, “So, how are you doing Hansel? With our…, situation?”

Sighing, Hansel responded, “A serious question this early in the morning? Well, as best as I think I can. Today, at least, we can get over to Mrs. Maple’s shop to figure things out. And what exactly are we going to do about clothes? It’s not like we can wear oversized T-shirts every day. There is a lot of stuff we have to figure out today.”

“True, there is a lot we have to figure out. But I just want to say ‘Thanks’ Hansel. For being a good sport about this whole situation. Even though this wasn’t what we both hand in mind when fooling around with that damn orb, I don’t think I could have held it together as well as I am if it wasn’t for you holding together so well,” said Robert.

Shocked, Hansel said, “That’s the reason why I’ve held it together. Because of how well you’ve held it together.”

Both boys smiled at that, everything didn’t seem so insurmountable at that particular moment.

“Well, what do you say we get some more experience walking down our ‘archnemesis’, The Stairs!” said Robert.

“Well the kitchen is downstairs and I am hungry,” said Hansel with a smile.

Robert gripped the handlebar of the bike harder, a nervous energy running through him. Though, he was not sure if it was just his anxiousness or if his friend/brother had some share of the blame. He could see Hansel's white knuckles gripping the left handlebar, and Robert knew that the churning their stomach stemmed from both of them.

As his uncles had explained before, being conjoined meant that emotions sometimes bled together. It was not that Robert could read Hansel's mind, or had some empathic ability to feel his other half's emotions. The reality was much more physical. The biological factors related to emotions inevitably effected them both to some extent. If Robert became angry, the stress hormones would build in their system, their heart would begin to beat faster, and Hansel would feel a tinge of anger grip him as well. Of if Hansel became sad, Robert's mood would dampen. However do to their current situation, they were both nervous which meant the anxiousness was compounded.

Robert focused on keeping time with Hansel's movement, allowing the bike to move forward at a leisurely pace. Slowly, his grip on the right handlebar relaxed. The risk of falling seemed to dwindle as they peddled down the long neighborhood road. Out of the corner of his eye, he caught Hansel with a wide grin. Robert could not help but match the expression.

They reached the edge of the cul-de-sac, the streets dead end, and Robert indicated for them to turn around. Just like they had practiced, they turned the handlebars to the left and leaned slightly. The bike gracefully turned around, and they began peddling back. They stopped in front of the driveway but stumbled getting off of the bike. Robert favored their right leg just as Hansel favored their left. So even after peddling and balancing together, they each still tried stepping off the bike in opposite directions. A reminder that they used to be two completely separate people.

Throwing his leg over so they could pull away from Hansel's side, Robert commented, "That was fun, wasn't it?"

"Yeah, it was good to go biking again." Hansel replied. With one hand on each handlebar still, they walked the bike into the garage and set it against the wall.

Mark and Mike stepped into the garage, keys in Mike's hand. "Good, you guys are back." Mike said upon seeing them. "We have to give Sarah a hand."

Sarah was the mutual fiancé of Robert's uncles, whom Robert was very familiar with. Over the weeks that he and Hanzel spent with Mike and Mark, Sarah had also been living with them. He liked her. She seemed to understand both of her uncles, and made them happy.

"Her tire blew out on the freeway." Mark explained as he and his brother stepped into the parked car. "She's fine, but we're going to replace it."

Robert had always been in awe at how his uncles moved so seamlessly together, as if they could reach each other's minds. Since being joined to Hansel, he had a new appreciation for their level of coordination. "Okay... I guess we'll see you guys soon."
